Sentencas: Ni-CeO2 composites with CeO2 of different morphologies (nanorods and nanocubes) are prepared and used as the hydrogen electrode of reversible solid oxide cells (RSOCs).
Titulo: The effect of CeO2 morphology on the electrochemical performance of the reversible solid oxide cells

Sentencas: Ni-CeO2 nanorods have larger surface area and more surface oxygen than Ni-CeO2 nanocubes.
Titulo: The effect of CeO2 morphology on the electrochemical performance of the reversible solid oxide cells

Sentencas: When the RSOCs are used as solid oxide fuel cells (SOFC), the maximum power densities (P-max) of the cells with Ni-CeO2 nanorods and Ni-CeO2 nanocubes as the anodes are 530.5 and 390.2 mW cm(-2), respectively, at 700 degrees C with H-2 as the fuel.
Titulo: The effect of CeO2 morphology on the electrochemical performance of the reversible solid oxide cells

Sentencas: The superficial diffusion of adsorbed II atom on Ni-CeO2 composites anode is the rate-determining step (RDS) for H-2 electrochemical oxidation reaction and the diffusion rate of the hydrogen atoms adsorbed on Ni-CeO2 nanorods are larger than that of hydrogen atoms adsorbed on Ni-CeO2 nanocubes.
Titulo: The effect of CeO2 morphology on the electrochemical performance of the reversible solid oxide cells

Sentencas: Furthermore, when the RSOCs are used as solid oxide electrolysis cells (SOECs), the electrolysis performances of the cell with Ni-CeO2 nanorods as the hydrogen electrode are better than those of the cell with Ni-CeO2 nanocubes as the hydrogen electrode at 700 degrees C under various H2O concentrations.
Titulo: The effect of CeO2 morphology on the electrochemical performance of the reversible solid oxide cells
